perturbation.original_text:
THIS CONTRACT is entered into by and between ENTERPRISE TRANSPORTATION COMPANY, a division of Enterprise Products Company, ("Carrier"),

and  ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS OPERATING L.P., a Delaware limited partnership - ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

P.O. Box 4324            Houston,          TX   77210     ("Shipper").
perturbation.changed_text:
THIS CONTRACT is entered into by and between ENTERPRISE TRANSPORTATION COMPANY, a division of Enterprise Products Company, ("Carrier"),

and  ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS OPERATING L.P., a Delaware limited partnership - ------------------------------------------------------------------------------

P.O. Box 4324            Houston,          TX   77210     ("Customer").
perturbation.explanation: The original contract refers to ENTERPRISE PRODUCTS OPERATING L.P. as "Shipper". This perturbation changes the term to "Customer" without changing the obligations of the party, creating confusion about their role.

perturbation.original_text:
Shipper shall tender commodities to Carrier for transportation by Carrier in a specialized service designed to meet the distinct needs of Shipper in  interstate or foreign commerce between points in the United States.

     2.   Shipper shall tender to Carrier and Carrier shall transport in a series of shipments not less than 10,000 pounds of Commodities per year.
perturbation.changed_text:
Customer shall tender commodities to Carrier for transportation by Carrier in a specialized service designed to meet the distinct needs of Shipper in  interstate or foreign commerce between points in the United States.

     2.   Account Holder shall tender to Carrier and Carrier shall transport in a series of shipments not less than 10,000 pounds of Commodities per year.
perturbation.explanation: The text changes "Shipper" to "Customer", and creates a new term "Account Holder" to also define Shipper. This creates a discrepancy in obligations. It's unclear if “Customer”, “Shipper” and "Account Holder" refer to the same entity.

perturbation.original_text: Carrier shall invoice Shipper for the services provided under this contract promptly upon performance.  All sums due under any invoice shall be payable without discount upon receipt of the invoice. Amounts more than 30 days past due shall bear interest from the due date to the date of payment at the lesser of 1) the rate of interest established by Chase Manhattan Bank, New York, NY, from time to time as its prime rate, plus two (2) percent, or 2) the maximum non-usurious interest rate which may be charged Shipper pursuant to applicable Texas law, Article 5069-1.04 Texas Rev. Civ. Stat., as amended.
perturbation.changed_text: Carrier shall invoice Customer for the services provided under this contract promptly upon performance.  All sums due under any invoice shall be payable without discount upon receipt of the invoice. Amounts more than 30 days past due shall bear interest from the due date to the date of payment at the lesser of 1) the rate of interest established by Chase Manhattan Bank, New York, NY, from time to time as its prime rate, plus two (2) percent, or 2) the maximum non-usurious interest rate which may be charged Account Holder pursuant to applicable Texas law, Article 5069-1.04 Texas Rev. Civ. Stat., as amended.
perturbation.explanation: In the first line, "Shipper" is replaced with "Customer". In the last line, the text changes “Shipper” to “Account Holder”. These terms, without any clarification or redefinition, create in-text contradictions.
